messages.content: What is the purpose of the Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct?

The purpose of the Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct is to make participation in the community a harassment-free experience for everyone and to act and interact in ways that contribute to an open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, and healthy community.
What are some examples of behavior that contributes to a positive environment according to the Code of Conduct?

Examples of behavior that contributes to a positive environment include demonstrating empathy and kindness toward other people, being respectful of differing opinions, viewpoints, and experiences, giving and gracefully accepting constructive feedback, accepting responsibility and apologizing to those affected by mistakes, and focusing on what is best for the overall community.
What are some examples of unacceptable behavior according to the Code of Conduct?

Examples of unacceptable behavior include the use of sexualized language or imagery, sexual attention or advances, trolling, insulting or derogatory comments, personal or political attacks, public or private harassment, publishing others' private information without their explicit permission, and other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a professional setting.
Who is responsible for clarifying and enforcing the standards of acceptable behavior in the community?
Community leaders are responsible for clarifying and enforcing the standards of acceptable behavior in the community.
Where does this Code of Conduct apply?
This Code of Conduct applies within all community spaces, and also applies when an individual is officially representing the community in public spaces.
How can instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior be reported?
Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior can be reported to the community leaders responsible for enforcement at @extrafuzzy_ on Discord.
What are the consequences for violating the Code of Conduct?
The consequences for violating the Code of Conduct can range from a correction, warning, temporary ban to a permanent ban depending on the severity and frequency of the violation.
What is the Code of Conduct adapted from?
This Code of Conduct is adapted from the Contributor Covenant, version 2.0.
What is ComfyUI-Cloud?
ComfyUI-Cloud is a custom node that allows users to run their ComfyUI workflow using cloud GPU resources while maintaining local control.
What are the benefits of using ComfyUI-Cloud?
ComfyUI-Cloud enables users to run workflows that require high VRAM without having to import custom nodes or models into cloud providers or spend money on a new GPU.
What GPU does ComfyUI-Cloud use?
ComfyUI-Cloud uses an Nvidia A10G 24GB VRAM GPU for running workflows.
How can I install the ComfyUI-Cloud plugin?
To install the ComfyUI-Cloud plugin, navigate to the 'custom_nodes' directory, clone the repository using 'git clone https://github.com/nathannlu/comfyui-cloud.git', and then run your workflow.
Where can I find the Getting Started guide for ComfyUI-Cloud?
The Getting Started guide for ComfyUI-Cloud can be found at https://github.com/nathannlu/ComfyUI-Cloud/blob/main/docs/get-started.md.
Who are the contributors or supporters of ComfyUI-Cloud?
ComfyUI-Cloud has received support or contributions from NVIDIA, Modal Labs, ComfyUI, and BennyKok.
Is ComfyUI-Cloud stable for use?
ComfyUI-Cloud is currently in beta stage, indicating that it is stable enough for users to try out.
What is the purpose of creating a bug report for ComfyUI-Cloud?
The purpose of creating a bug report for ComfyUI-Cloud is to help improve the software by providing a clear and concise description of the bug.
What should be included in the 'To Reproduce' section of a ComfyUI-Cloud bug report?
The 'To Reproduce' section should include steps to reproduce the behavior, such as going to a specific location, clicking on something, scrolling down, and seeing the error.
What should be described in the 'Expected behavior' section of a ComfyUI-Cloud bug report?
The 'Expected behavior' section should provide a clear and concise description of what the user expected to happen when encountering the bug.
Should screenshots be added to a ComfyUI-Cloud bug report?
Yes, if applicable, screenshots should be added to help explain the problem in a ComfyUI-Cloud bug report.
What desktop information should be completed in a ComfyUI-Cloud bug report?
The desktop information that should be completed in a ComfyUI-Cloud bug report includes the operating system, browser, and version.
What smartphone information should be completed in a ComfyUI-Cloud bug report?
The smartphone information that should be completed in a ComfyUI-Cloud bug report includes the device, operating system, browser, and version.
What should be included in the 'Additional context' section of a ComfyUI-Cloud bug report?
The 'Additional context' section of a ComfyUI-Cloud bug report should include any other context or information about the problem that may be relevant.
How can I start using ComfyUI-Cloud?
Once you have installed the custom node, you will notice a new button appearing on your right-hand panel labeled 'Generate on Cloud' below the 'Queue Prompt' button. Click on this button to begin.
What is the purpose of creating an account for ComfyUI-Cloud?
Currently, the account is utilized to keep your generated images private and to manage your generation credits if you opt to purchase more.
What happens after I log in and click the 'Generate on Cloud' button again?
You will be able to name and upload your workflow. The custom node will search for models, custom nodes, and images your workflow relies on and subsequently upload them to your cloud.
How long does the upload process take?
The upload process may take some time, particularly if your workflow utilizes numerous custom nodes and models.
What should I do if my ComfyUI utilizes models from Automatic1111 installation via extra_model_paths.yaml?
You must relocate the models to inside ComfyUI and deactivate Comfy's extra_model_paths.yaml.
What happens upon completion of the upload process?
A Comfy Cloud node will be created in your workflow, automatically executing your workflow in the cloud once.
How can I access all cloud workflow runs?
You can access all cloud workflow runs by clicking the blue 'View past runs' button in your Comfy Cloud node.
How can I view my most recent generation?
To locate your most recent generation, scroll to the bottom of the table that pops up after clicking 'View past runs' and select the item with the latest timestamp.
